title: Rear Suspension Unit - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
RSU installation CB7; CG7; CM7; CN7; CS7; CT7, CX7, CE7
Pack the drag link bearings with multi-purpose grease to NLGI 2 specification.
Refit the rear suspension unit to the motorcycle by raising the unit upwards through the hole in the swinging arm.
Locate the drag links to the rear suspension unit and refit the sleeve.
Locate the rear suspension unit and insert the upper mounting bolt from the left side to hold the rear suspension unit.
to tighten the frame adjuster to
Fit the washer and loosely fit a new nut.
Reposition the drop link plates and, from the right hand side, loosely fit the bolt and a new nut.
Tighten the drag link to rear suspension unit fixing to
With the weight of the motorcycle on its wheels, tighten the rear suspension unit upper mounting to
Refit the plastic blanking plugs at the left and right sides that cover the rear suspension unit upper mounting fixing.

search: Rear Suspension Unit - Installation
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Fixings
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Tightening Procedures
Pack the drag link bearings with multi-purpose grease to NLGI 2 specification.
Refit the rear suspension unit to the motorcycle by raising the unit upwards through the hole in the swinging arm.
Locate the drag links to the rear suspension unit and refit the sleeve.
Locate the rear suspension unit and insert the upper mounting bolt from the left side to hold the rear suspension unit.
At the right side, use
service tool T3880104
to tighten the frame adjuster to
10 Nm
Fit the washer and loosely fit a new nut.
Reposition the drop link plates and, from the right hand side, loosely fit the bolt and a new nut.
Drag link
Drop links
Fixings
Rear suspension unit
Tighten the drag link to rear suspension unit fixing to
80 Nm
With the weight of the motorcycle on its wheels, tighten the rear suspension unit upper mounting to
60 Nm
Refit the plastic blanking plugs at the left and right sides that cover the rear suspension unit upper mounting fixing.
Perform the following operations:
Battery - Terminal Connect
Rider's Seat - Removal/Installation
